attributes.action: Extend the COVID-19 vaccination programme to all 12-17 year olds
attributes.additional_details: While many countries around the world (such as the US, Israel and Canada) have successfully begun vaccinating over-12s, this country has still yet to even make plans to offer COVID-19 vaccines to all over-12s. In order to avoid more disruption to young people’s education and prevent a new variant (with the Delta variant already being more transmissible among younger people), we must give all 12-17 year olds the opportunity to protect themselves and others.
attributes.background: The UK’s vaccination programme currently does not allow under-18s who are not considered vulnerable or who do not live with someone with a weak immune system to get vaccinated. The Government should allow all 12-17 year olds to get vaccinated to protect as much of the population as possible.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign the below petition that is currently open on this topic:

Offer the Covid-19 vaccine to under 18s
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589254
